item.title: Secure torrenting with OpenBSD rdomains
item.description: Introduction I’ve been spending my recent time off tinkering with my neglected home network. OpenBSD has been a core feature of my home network ever since I was a student, I usually have some sort of OpenBSD server as well as an OpenBSD router. I like it’s simplicity and its stability, but most of all I appreciate OpenBSD as a learning tool. The kernel code is much easier to navigate and read than the Linux kernel, so if you’re interested in learning more about operating systems it’s a great place to start.
